replies.bodyText: After level up dialogue the fishing animation continues for some time, and it was unclear to me if fishing was actually taking place, but I agree it's unneeded and it has been removed along with non-fishing animations.
replies.author: BrandtHill

timeline.body: This animation is uninterrupted, however a different animation plays when a player has caught a fish bare-handed, and that animation is missing here. (There are different animations for each type of fish caught)
timeline.bodyText: This animation is uninterrupted, however a different animation plays when a player has caught a fish bare-handed, and that animation is missing here. (There are different animations for each type of fish caught)

replies.bodyText:
I found four new undocumented animations (6703, 6704 upon start, 6710, 6711 upon catch) whilst barehanded fishing for Tuna. My Fishing level is 63. Can anyone with a higher fishing level let me know what the animation IDs are for Swordfish and Sharks?
To find I'd just throw if (client.getLocalPlayer().getAnimation() != -1) log.info("Animation: {}", client.getLocalPlayer().getAnimation()); at the top of onGameTick()
replies.author: BrandtHill

timeline.body: These Barehanded caught animations (and maybe windup ones too) are specific to Tuna, so names are subject to change once we figure out what Shark/Swordfish ones are
timeline.bodyText: These Barehanded caught animations (and maybe windup ones too) are specific to Tuna, so names are subject to change once we figure out what Shark/Swordfish ones are
timeline.bodyHTML: These Barehanded caught animations (and maybe windup ones too) are specific to Tuna, so names are subject to change once we figure out what Shark/Swordfish ones are
timeline.author: BrandtHill

timeline.bodyHTML:
These are not named correctly. Since these apply only to tuna, they should be named appropriately to reflect that.

Suggested change
public static final int FISHING_BAREHAND_CAUGHT_1 = 6710;
public static final int FISHING_BAREHAND_CAUGHT_2 = 6711;
public static final int FISHING_BAREHAND_CAUGHT_TUNA_1 = 6710;
public static final int FISHING_BAREHAND_CAUGHT_TUNA_2 = 6711;
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

replies.bodyText: Thank you for finding the rest of these animations.
replies.author: BrandtHill

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
private final ImmutableSet<Integer> fishingAnimations = new ImmutableSet.Builder<Integer>()
private final ImmutableSet<Integer> fishingAnimations = new ImmutableSet.Builder<>()
timeline.author: Adam-

timeline.body:
This field can be made `static`, be defined as a `Set` (or even a `Collection` since we're not calling any set-specific methods of it), and renamed to match the constant naming schema:
```suggestion
	private static final Set<Integer> FISHING_ANIMATIONS = ImmutableSet.of(
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
This field can be made static, be defined as a Set (or even a Collection since we're not calling any set-specific methods of it), and renamed to match the constant naming schema:

Suggested change
private final ImmutableSet<Integer> fishingAnimations = ImmutableSet.of(
private static final Set<Integer> FISHING_ANIMATIONS = ImmutableSet.of(
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.message:
fishing: Check player animation to update fishing status

This commit adds an animation check to the other fishing status checks
already present in the fishing overlay (interacting and fishing spot NPC
name check) to ensure that the status correctly changes to "NOT fishing"
when the player's fishing animation is interrupted by certain actions
such as being presented with a level-up dialog. This commit causes one
other behavioral change as a side effect, which is that the player's
fishing status will be "NOT fishing" while running toward a distant
fishing spot until they reach it and start their fishing animation.

Fixes runelite/runelite#10900
